page.title: 17WOODLEIGH WOOD
page.content: Deciduous woodland extends along virtually the whole length of the steep eastern flanks of the Avon valley, and along about half of the western slopes. Woodleigh Wood is typical of these woods, and is being maintained by The Woodland Trust. There is a public footpath, or one can follow the nearby old railway track. The trees are mixed, with mature oak and beech, and some sweet chestnut. Ash and sycamore are very common,the latter seeding itself very freely. At the northern end some birch are seeding. Along the nearby old railway track sycamore, ash, alder and birch are taking over. In the wood hazel and holly form a lower layer. The woodland floor is very colourful in spring, with bluebells,wild garlic, wild daffodils, campions and ferns.
